term.title: isoconjugate systems

item.text: Molecular entities with similar conjugate networks which have the same number of Ï€-electrons, e.g. cyclopentadienide anion and pyrrole or benzene and pyridine.

sources.item: PAC, 1999, 71, 1919. 'Glossary of terms used in theoretical organic chemistry' on page 1947 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199971101919)

term.citation: Citation: 'isoconjugate systems' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.IT07059

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
